main event: A single unidentified object was observed falling through the sky in Brooklyn, New York on January 20, 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3-4 seconds,It appeared to have an elongated cylindrical shape,Unlike typical meteors, the object did not leave a visible trail and became brighter as it descended,Approximately 25 witnesses were present, including a duty officer who was observing the sky.
witness description: Observing officer and possibly more than 25 people in the surrounding area
